metadata.Title: CVE-2016-2108 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - high.
metadata.Description:
The ASN.1 implementation in OpenSSL before 1.0.1o and 1.0.2 before 1.0.2c allows remote attackers to execute arbitrary code or cause a denial of service (buffer underflow and memory corruption) via an ANY field in crafted serialized data, aka the "negative zero" issue.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-2108` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

libssl1.0.0 - 1.0.1f-1ubuntu2.19
openssl - 1.0.1f-1ubuntu2.19
No subscription required

advisory.DiscoveredBy: Huzaifa Sidhpurwala, Hanno BÃ¶ck, and David Benjamin

notes.Note: mdeslaur> requires two commits, both required for vulnerability first part already in wily+

criterions.comment: openssl package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1.0.1f-1ubuntu2.19').
openssl098: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
